Description: Fragmentary handle of a vessel?: bent strip of bronze with raised ridge runing down centre; broken at both ends; projecting from one side is a cone-shaped object.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Possibly part of a bronze vessel, with Late Republican parallels (Feugère and Rolley 1991). Feugère, M. and Rolley, C. 1991. La vaisselle tardo-républicaine en bronze. Dijon.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (RB.04)
